main event: A round, white object approximately 120 feet in diameter was observed over Minot, North Dakota, on July 27, 1957.
interesting points: The object was traveling at a very high speed and was seen stopping and starting at increasing distances., Conclusions suggested it might have been a weather balloon or aircraft., The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes., The observation included data from both ground and air intercept radar., There were attempts to correlate the sighting with satellite activity but remained inconclusive.
